ARABIC: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If only we could have another chance then we would be among the mumin
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If only we could return and be among the believers!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: If only we could return we would be among the believers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Would that we could have a chance to live again so that we might become believers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “So if only were we to go back, in order to become Muslims!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: (Alas!) If we only had a chance to return, we shall truly be among the believers!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But if we could but once return, we would be of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: O that we might return again, and be among the believers!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Oh, that we had another turn (on earth), that we might be of the believers!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: If we could only return to the world and be among the believers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Were there for us a return, we would be of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Had there been another turn for us, we would be among the faithful.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Now if we only had a chance of return we shall truly be of those who believe!'"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (Alas!) If we only had a chance to return (to the world), we shall truly be among the believers!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Would that we might return again, and be among the believers'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: If only we could have another chance, we would be among the faithful.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers... "
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:102] If only we had another turn, [another] return to this world, we would have been among those who believe!’ (law, ‘if only’, here is for [the conditional] optative, to which nakūna, ‘we would have been’, constitutes the response).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Oh, that we had another turn) in the life of the world, (that we might be of the believers!
